bioghist.p: Charles Adolphe Albert Fauvel (1840-1921) was an attorney by profession who dedicated much of his time to the study of entomology. He published many papers, monographs, and catalogs. He was a noted expert on the family Staphylinidae. He described 1851 species and 96 genera of Staphylinidae. In 1882 Fauvel founded, in Caen, the journal Revue dâ€™Entomologie and edited it through 28 volumes until 1910. In 1910, without warning the subscribers or contributing authors, he abruptly stopped publication of his journal, discontinued all connections, withdrew entirely from scientific and public life, and stayed in seclusion until his death in 1921.

scopecontent.p: 1875 letter in French, recipient unknown, discussing receipt of reprints and specimens, particularly those of G.R. Crotch, with whom Fauvel had worked in Caen. The letter also includes a list of Staphylinides in Fauvel's collection.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
